result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Possession of a Firearm While Intoxicated

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marvion I. Washington

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 20, 2022 at 09:15 am.

9:48 am case called. Prosecuting Attorney Trenton John Piltz in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Marvion I. Washington in court with Attorney Kevin G. Dague. Defendant enters Not Guilty pleas. Court receives the pleas.

Branch 5 Judicial Assistance for further scheduling.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Attorney Kevin Dague - at $100/hr.  Defendant shall reimburse Eau Claire County by making payments of $100.00 beginning 10/07/2022 and every 30 days thereafter.  Payment shall not exceed the full cost of representation.

Conditions:
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant not to drive without a valid driver's license.
No use or possession of firearms.

Case called at 11:46 AM.
Defendant Marvion I. Washington appeared by video, in custody from the jail with Attorney Sonia Anderson. Prosecuting Attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 9/28/22 at 1:45 PM. 
RTN: 10/19/22 at 9:30 AM.
